news.title: At least 30 killed by Israeli fire while waiting for aid, Gaza civil defence ministry says
news.summary: Israel says it is examining the incident, but is "unaware" of casualties from Israeli gunfire.

news.title: British 999 caller's voice cloned by Russian network using AI
news.summary: A BBC Verify investigation has revealed that the identities of British public sector workers have been cloned using AI by a Russian-linked disinformation campaign.

news.title: Airlines demand answers after air traffic control failure
news.summary: Ten flights to and from Heathrow were cancelled on Thursday, on top of some 150 across the UK on Wednesday.

news.title: 'Endless battle': Fighting the crime gangs taking over the High Street
news.summary: People say they're terrified of going to the shops, with reports of intimidation and open drug dealing.

news.title: 'Communities' of strange, extreme life seen for first time in deep ocean
news.summary: A Chinese-led research team captures pictures of life at depths of more than 9km in the northwest Pacific Ocean.

news.title: Hotel tycoon reveals Heathrow expansion proposal
news.summary: Arora Group says a shorter runway will avoid the cost and disruption of diverting the M25 motorway.

news.title: US allies break with Trump to force diplomatic shift on Gaza
news.summary: As Canada joins France and the UK with plans to recognise a Palestinian state, the US stands firmly with Israel - but does Trump have a long-term plan for Gaza's future?

news.title: The Papers: 'Prince of Sadness' and 'Air we go again'
news.summary: The final public farewell for Ozzy Osbourne and air traffic chaos across the UK dominate Thursday's papers.

news.title: How Trump's tariffs are already impacting Americans
news.summary: The US is seeing increased tariffs income, but there are signs of some countries diverting trade from America.

news.title: Ford says Trump tariffs to cost it about $2bn this year
news.summary: It is the latest indication of the impact of US President Donald Trump's tariffs on big American firms.
